channel.title: Partial (CNAME) setup on Security365 Docs
channel.description: Recent content in Partial (CNAME) setup on Security365 Docs

item.title: Setup
item.description: Set up a partial (CNAME) zoneA partial (CNAME) setup allows you to use Cloudflare’s reverse proxy while maintaining your primary and authoritative DNS provider. Use this option to proxy only individual subdomains through Cloudflare’s global edge network when you cannot change your authoritative DNS provider. A partial setup is only available to customers on a Business or Enterprise plan. ​​ Step 1 — Add your domain to Cloudflare Create a Cloudflare account and add your domain.

item.title: Convert to full setup
item.description: Convert partial setup to full setupIf you initially set up a partial domain on Cloudflare, you can later migrate it to a full setup. ​​ Step 1 — Prepare Cloudflare SSL/TLS In the Cloudflare dashboard, either order an advanced certificate or upload a custom SSL certificate for your application. You also should verify that the status of your SSL certificate is Active. Universal SSL only supports first-level subdomains. For more coverage and additional flexibility, you can purchase an Advanced Certificate or upload a Custom SSL certificate.

item.title: DNS resolution
item.description: DNS resolution in partial zonesWhen you have a partial zone1, Cloudflare handles DNS records a bit differently from full zones in order to internally resolve the origin server where proxied HTTP requests are sent to. ​​ Records within the same zone When you create a new DNS record in a partial zone, Cloudflare automatically checks whether any of your CNAME records point to existing A, AAAA, or CNAME records within the same zone.
